entry.title: Inconvenience
entry.summary:
Author: LovestruckTomato

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,877Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Clark Kent just wants to enjoy his walk, but, of course, he gets kidnapped. Why? Well, because he's Bruce Wayne's latest boy toy. Ordinarily, he'd be able to escape, but things are complicated when he discovers his secret identity may be revealed. To pass the time, he travels down memory lane, recalling his love story with Bruce.Meanwhile, Bruce is wondering how in the hell some amateurs kidnapped an invulnerable alien hero, but, regardless, he misses Clark too.

entry.title: four people to a marriage
entry.summary:
Author: C4ndyN3cklace

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,770Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 84

Summary: The deadlines are really taking a tole now; Clark’s rent has been due for so long his new worry is the next payment, the farm is under threat by the bank, he still doesn’t have the quotes he needs for an investigative article on high society—and their connection to organised crime—he was poking around for during a gala. …Which he never got around to. Instead, he got Bruce Wayne’s ‘personal’ number and stumbled his way into a very formal date—and a less than night. So now he’s laying in-between steam pressed sheets dreading when Brucie Wayne steps out of the hotel bathroom. — It’s time to lay Brucie Wayne to rest. The Penguin, apparently, has had his claws curled around the upperclass of Gotham for a while longer than Batman had ever thought. His influence runs deep but the numbers—bank transfers, unexpected marriages, random disappearances—run deeper. His own parents were apart of this, knowingly or not, and Batman needs the proof to cement Cobblepots’s arrest. He has, however, recently been confronted by a roadblock. A bank account, possessing a fortune of dirty money, not to be released to Mr. Wayne until he’s taken a Mrs. Or been pronounced married, the bank doesn’t care.

entry.title: I love you (it’s ruining my life)
entry.summary:
Author: writinganddying

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,864Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: “It’s ok, you can drain me.” He whispers. Lust and hunger are fairly similar feelings. Bruce Wayne has been starved for so long. Taking only the smallest amount of blood he needs and pushing away his sexual needs. He was too strong to not destroy humans and vampires were too hard to find. “You’re not scared of me?” Bruce asks back in the same whisper. “No. I want you to drain me.” “God, you’re so fucking hot.” He digs his teeth into Clark’s neck. Or Bruce Wayne is a vampire and Clark Kent is his newest victim

entry.title: Sun Starved
entry.summary:
Author: Fish_stik

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,464Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Bruce had just been patrolling one night. That's all. Nothing world-ending (not that Alfred knew about his nightly ventures—which itself might be Bruce-ending), and yet here he was. Dragged to some backwater summer camp for "half-bloods" by a young woman after helping her fight off some weird meta thug, where everyone took Ancient Greek myths far too seriously. Don't get him wrong, he loved those stories; he basically grew up on them, but there was no way that this was all real.   Like, come on... A half-horse activities director? Magical strawberry fields? It was all too much, and that was coming from the guy from a city overrun with metas and who lived right next door to the place with an alien as its hero. Though Bruce didn't know or even trust the guy (?), Superman made far more sense than these demigods.  Bruce fights a minotaur with Diana and gets dragged to Camp Half-Blood, where he then finds out he’s a demigod, makes a very attractive friend, and finds out the sun has been stolen. What a killer summer…

entry.title: Less a Man Than a Myth
entry.summary:
Author: aerey

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,379Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: Superman is hope personified. He is light and smiles and the sun after a storm - the people trust him. He knows this. He knows it when he is Clark Kent, average reporter, and he knows it when he is approached by his fellow heroes, one year into his crusade as the Man of Steel, to join a new group for Earth's defense. The Justice League.He gets along with Wonder Woman and the Flash and Green Lantern and all the other new heroes, but Batman proves to be a challenge. The hero from Gotham is cryptid, gruff, and if Clark weren't raised with manners, he'd even say a pain in the ass.However, as the years pass, things change. There are the occasional moments where Clark is able to drop his Superman smile and simply *be*. What do all these moments have in common? Batman (Bruce, as he comes to know him). Superman, for once, is able to exist in the in between of ideals, masks, and lies to find true friendship. And when friendship is no longer a word enough to describe what the two of them share - well that's when things get tricky.

entry.title: Burnt Toast and Kitchen Confidential
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,311Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: When Alfred leaves Bruce and Clark alone for one night, domestic peace in Wayne Manor doesn’t last long. Clark decides to cook dinner using heat vision — and turns the kitchen into a museum of melted appliances, scorched bread, and heroic regret. Bruce comes home from patrol to find his partner looking guilty and the soup missing in action. Between sarcasm, cleanup duty, and one soft kiss under the lingering smell of burnt toast, they learn that not every disaster needs saving — some just need laughter (and takeout).
